intro: Spermacoce dispersa, commonly known as the spreading spermacoce, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, Asia, and the Americas. The plant is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, white to pinkish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds. Spermacoce dispersa is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including forests and grasslands.
